is there any other audio recording or editing software that us poor people =
may be able to afford?
Kathy
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: juli v=
elazquez 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, April 12, 2008 1=
0:30 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Most amazing session


  Honey as soon as =
you turn audition on, it should have asked you.  If not try going into your=
 file section and you should be able to recover it as the last session and/=
or file done.

  Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote: 
    tell m=
e how to recover 

    Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote: 
    =
  Hi Rees,

      Audition can recover an unsaved session in case the progr=
am (or
      computer) should crash.

      But perhaps it was intention th=
at the session was not saved - who
      knows... paranormal phenomena are =
often elusive by their nature.

      Stefan

      -- 

      > Hey Willia=
m I believe they were training you in computer procedures...save file...sav=
e file...save file...you can never save too much. LOL Ron L

      > Wiliam=
 Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote: I'm guessing nobody believes me! O=
 well I would like to tell you that it really is true, and I know in my hea=
rt, because I was there. Not
      > sure why them cpu went off, but maybe =
I had too much infomation then they wanted me too.( I record write on to my=
 laptop, and I don't use any type of digital or analog recorder). I will pr=
ove it
      > again. Tonight I am going to do everything the same to see i=
f I can get it to happen again.

      > Rees

      > reesclarke_69 <reesc=
larke_69@...> wrote:
      > Hey guys

      > I had the most amazing=
 session last night. Me and my fiance 
      > did a session, and this is h=
ow it went. 

      > We usally do 10 min. of audio, and during the session=
 we first 
      > contacted a guy named Virgil, and we got him to say both=
 of our 
      > names. He said "William" for me, and "Leigh" for Ashley. W=
e all 
      > communicated for the 10 min. He didn't answer every question=
, but 
      > he answered 75% of all answerslast night. We told him that w=
e 
      > wanted to prove that they exsisted on the other side. Life after=
 
      > death. He answer "we are over here", very plainly. After the 10 
=
      > min. We ask for confirmation so we could shut off the radio, and we=
 
      > got this answer "that would be a bad idea". Which freaked Ashley =

      > out. So we kept the radio on and we had a conversation with this 
=
      > preacher, then while the band was still sweeping the preacher came =

      > through and he talked to us (while sweeping the band), and started=
 
      > to preach to us about our side, and how messed up it is.(the band=
 
      > was sweeping the whole time, I never stop the band from sweeping)=
 
      > He said that we needed to pray for our enemies as well as our 
  =
    > friends and families. He talked to us for 6 to eight minutes. 
      =
> Then we finished the session (Ask for confirmation)when he didn't 
      =
> come through any more. We shut down. Then of course I get up and 
      >=
 put everything back the way it is supposed to be. Leaving the 
      > ses=
sion that we just did on the laptop. Then I went to take a 
      > shower,=
 and I come back. The laptop was turned off and I lost all 
      > of the =
session. Sometimes the computer will log itself off, then 
      > when you=
 get back it is exactly the was it was when you left it. 
      > But this =
wasn't the case, some reason the laptop shut itself off, 
      > and we lo=
st all of the evidence that we had. Didn't have nothing, 
      > and I cou=
ldn't believe that we lost everything. So thats why I am 
      > sitting h=
ere typing away about what happen last night. Instead of 
      > me postin=
g files about what happen last night. I wish so bad that 
      > y'all wou=
ld have been able to hear the communication. It was a life 
      > changin=
g experience. It made me think a whole lot different about 
      > box res=
earch. I still can't believe I didn't save it before the 
      > computer =
turned itself off. That is what happen to me last night, 
      > and chang=
e box research for me for the rest of my life.

      > Thanks

      > Wil=
liam Rees Clarke III
